qas.question: Passenger elevators, used in city transport share similarities to what other ascending and descending vehicles counterbalancing each other?
What type of public elevator in Yalta, Ukraine, transport passengers from a hill above the Black Sea to a tunnel down on the beach?
The elevator located at the Casco Viejo station in the Bilbao Metro is also used for what?

answers.text: ticket barriers are set up in such a way that passengers can pay to reach the elevator from the entrance in the lower city, or vice versa

context: Sometimes passenger elevators are used as a city transport along with <a0_0>funiculars<a0_0/>. For example, there is a 3-station <a1_0>underground public elevator<a1_0/> in Yalta, Ukraine, which takes passengers from the top of a hill above the Black Sea on which hotels are perched, to a tunnel located on the beach below. At Casco Viejo station in the Bilbao Metro, the elevator that provides access to the station from a hilltop neighborhood doubles as <a2_0>city transportation<a2_0/>: the station's <a3_0>ticket barriers are set up in such a way that passengers can pay to reach the elevator from the entrance in the lower city, or vice versa<a3_0/>. See also the Elevators for urban transport section.
